sen.e: He was such a fervent adherent of Kumano faith (Kumano was believed to be a dwelling place of the gods) that he was known to have made more than twenty pilgrimages to Kumano shrines both officially and privately; his pilgrimages in 1210, in 1216, and in 1229 were recounted in his diary, "Dairy of Lord Yorisuke."
